org.opendaylight.controller.clustering.services

Interface IClusterServices

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClusterManager

    public interface IClusterServices
    Set of services an application will expect from the clustering services provider

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IClusterServices.cacheMode
      Enumeration of the several modality with which a ConcurrentHashMap cache can be requested to the clustering services.
      static class  IClusterServices.cacheProps
      Enumeration of the several properties that a cache can carry

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(java.lang.String containerName, java.lang.String cacheName, IGetUpdates<?,?> u)
      Register an update handler for a given containerName/cacheName shared data structure.
      boolean amIStandby()
      Deprecated. 
      Function that says if we are standby in the 1-1 redundancy with active/standby model. The API is not encouraged hence is deprecated. It is supposed to be used as a stop-gap till the active-standby goal is achieved. The only guys that are supposed to use are: - southbound layer, should not listen on the OF port if standby - jetty configuration, on standby jetty should redirect calls to the active.
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<?,?> createCache(java.lang.String containerName, java.lang.String cacheName, java.util.Set<IClusterServices.cacheMode> cMode)
      Method that will create a new named cache per-container.
      void destroyCache(java.lang.String containerName, java.lang.String cacheName)
      Destroy a cachename given containerName/cachename, if doesn't exist the function does nothing.
      boolean existCache(java.lang.String containerName, java.lang.String cacheName)
      Function to test the existance of a cache with a given name already

      Deprecated. 
      Get the InetAddress of the active controller for the active-standby case, where the standby controller has to redirect the HTTP requests received from applications layer

    • Method Detail

      • createCache

        java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<?,?> createCache(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                  java.lang.String cacheName,
                                                  java.util.Set<IClusterServices.cacheMode> cMode)
                                                    throws CacheExistException,
                                                           CacheConfigException
        Method that will create a new named cache per-container. The data structure if already present will cause an exception to be thrown to the caller.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to create
        cMode - Mode of the cache that need to be retrieved. This is a set such that more than one property can be provided, of course contrasting requirements will not be accepted and in that case an exception is thrown
        Returns:
        ConcurrentHashMap to be used to modify the data structure
        Throws:
        CacheExistException
        CacheConfigException

      • getCache

        java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<? extends java.lang.Object,? extends java.lang.Object> getCache(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                                                 java.lang.String cacheName)
        Method that will retrieve and return the handle to modify a data structire distributed via clustering services. The datastructure shall already have been created else a null reference will be returned.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to retrieve
        Returns:
        ConcurrentHashMap to be used to modify the data structure

      • destroyCache

        void destroyCache(java.lang.String containerName,
                java.lang.String cacheName)
        Destroy a cachename given containerName/cachename, if doesn't exist the function does nothing. If the datastructure exists, the whole cluster will destroy the instance
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to destroy

      • existCache

        boolean existCache(java.lang.String containerName,
                 java.lang.String cacheName)
        Function to test the existance of a cache with a given name already
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to destroy
        Returns:
        true if exists already, false otherwise

      • getCacheList

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getCacheList(java.lang.String containerName)
        Return the list of all teh caches registered with a container
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container for which we want to list all the caches registered
        Returns:
        The set of names, expressed as strings

      • getCacheProperties

        java.util.Properties getCacheProperties(java.lang.String containerName,
                                      java.lang.String cacheName)
        Return a list of properties that caracterize the cache
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container where data structure resides
        cacheName - Name of the cache
        Returns:
        The list of properties related to the cache

      • addListener

        void addListener(java.lang.String containerName,
               java.lang.String cacheName,
               IGetUpdates<?,?> u)
                 throws CacheListenerAddException
        Register an update handler for a given containerName/cacheName shared data structure. Multiple listeners are possible.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap for which we want to register the listener
        u - Interface to invoke when the updates are received
        Throws:
        CacheListenerAddException

      • getListeners

        java.util.Set<IGetUpdates<?,?>> getListeners(java.lang.String containerName,
                                           java.lang.String cacheName)
        Return a set of interfaces that are interesteed to listen to updates coming for a given datastructure shared via clustering services.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap for which we want to retrieve the listener

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(java.lang.String containerName,
                  java.lang.String cacheName,
                  IGetUpdates<?,?> u)
        UN-Register an update handler for a given containerName/cacheName shared data structure. Multiple listeners are possible.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Container to which the datastructure is associated
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap for which we want to un-register the listener
        u - Interface to un-register

      • tbegin

        void tbegin()
            throws javax.transaction.NotSupportedException,
                   javax.transaction.SystemException
        Begin a transaction covering with all the data structures/HW updates. One transaction per-thread can be opened at the most, that means if multiple thread are available, multiple transactions can be outstanding.
        Throws:
        javax.transaction.NotSupportedException
        javax.transaction.SystemException

      • tbegin

        void tbegin(long timeout,
          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
            throws javax.transaction.NotSupportedException,
                   javax.transaction.SystemException
        tbegin with a timeout
        Parameters:
        timeout - the transaction timeout
        unit - TimeUnit for the timeout
        Throws:
        javax.transaction.NotSupportedException
        javax.transaction.SystemException
        See Also:
        tbegin()

      • tcommit

        void tcommit()
             throws javax.transaction.RollbackException,
                    javax.transaction.HeuristicMixedException,
                    javax.transaction.HeuristicRollbackException,
                    java.lang.SecurityException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    javax.transaction.SystemException
        Commit a transaction covering all the data structures/HW updates.
        Throws:
        javax.transaction.RollbackException
        javax.transaction.HeuristicMixedException
        javax.transaction.HeuristicRollbackException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.SecurityException,

      • tgetTransaction

        javax.transaction.Transaction tgetTransaction()
                                              throws javax.transaction.SystemException
        Return the javax.transaction.Transaction associated with this thread
        Returns:
        Return the current transaction associated with this thread
        Throws:
        javax.transaction.SystemException

      • amIStandby

        @Deprecated
boolean amIStandby()
        Deprecated. Function that says if we are standby in the 1-1 redundancy with active/standby model. The API is not encouraged hence is deprecated. It is supposed to be used as a stop-gap till the active-standby goal is achieved. The only guys that are supposed to use are: - southbound layer, should not listen on the OF port if standby - jetty configuration, on standby jetty should redirect calls to the active.
        Returns:
        true if the role is the one of standby, else false

      • getActiveAddress

        @Deprecated
java.net.InetAddress getActiveAddress()
        Deprecated. Get the InetAddress of the active controller for the active-standby case, where the standby controller has to redirect the HTTP requests received from applications layer
        Returns:
        Address of the active controller

      • getClusteredControllers

        java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> getClusteredControllers()
        Get the InetAddress of the all the controllers that make up this Cluster
        Returns:
        List of InetAddress'es of all the controllers

      • getMyAddress

        java.net.InetAddress getMyAddress()
        Get the InetAddress of this Controller as seen by the Cluster Manager
        Returns:
        InetAddress of this Controller as seen by the Cluster Manager.

      • listenRoleChange

        @Deprecated
void listenRoleChange(IListenRoleChange i)
                      throws ListenRoleChangeAddException
        Deprecated. Register a listener to the event of ChangeRole, raised every time there is a change in the role of active or standby.
        Parameters:
        i - Interface that will be called when the Role Change happens
        Throws:
        ListenRoleChangeAddException

      • unlistenRoleChange

        @Deprecated
void unlistenRoleChange(IListenRoleChange i)
        Deprecated. UN-Register a listener to the event of ChangeRole, raised every time there is a change in the role of active or standby.
        Parameters:
        i - Interface that will be called when the Role Change happens
